revised_title: Adaptive Changes in Yeast Cells: A Study on Aneurin and Raffinose Utilization
tldr: The authors investigated the adaptive changes in yeast cells when trained to dispense with added aneurin or to utilize raffinose. They found that the training process affects the bulk of the population rather than selecting exceptional mutants. The study also showed that the growth rates of haploid strains derived from the same diploid parent were similar, but the initial values varied widely.
